Articles.Content:
Bought KSP yesterday after playing illegally for a few weeks.

I like the default KSP, no add-ons for me (yet).

Did a succesful manual docking on my second attempt (my years of flightsim experience really paid off in using the navball)

No real objectives, just fun. I do however try to simulate the NASA program from the 60's.

I am currently making an apollo style rocket and lander.

Now i made the lander and it works, but in the illlegal version i had i could not import this into another rocket.

I hope it is now possible to import modules from earlier saved rockets. Otherwise i will have to make the whole rocket from the top-down which i think is hard.

I also hope it is now possible to save the sequence list on the right. Before i had to set the order of stages/seperation every time before launch.

I try not to look at other people's designs as i want to develop everything myself.
Well, we certainly do not condone pirating the game, but you are not the first person who liked it so much as to repent by buying a legitimate copy. Congratulations on redeeming yourself.

Thanks.

Yeah i do want to appreciate the work of the developers by buying it. I have a ****load of games original in box. I do however often try an illegal copy first.

Honesty is best.

Welcome to the freakshow

And yes, we do not like pirates, but you have cleared yourself so it's all good.

Also, there is a sub-assembly where you can save your launchers or landers.

Fly safe.

Hey there.

We definitely do not condone pirating around here, but thanks for your honesty. As a member of Squad, we're glad you liked it enough to take the plunge and make a purchase. You're stuck for life, pal. Get comfy
